Aperiam numquam tempore, laudantium perferendis recusandae autem.</ui5-label> </ui5-tab> </ui5-tabcontainer> TabContainer with text only tabs <ui5-tabcontainer class="full-width" collapsed fixed show-overflow> <ui5-tab text="Home"></ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="What's new" selected></ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="Who are we"></ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="About"></ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="Contacts"></ui5-tab> </ui5-tabcontainer> TabContainer with text and additional-text <ui5-tabcontainer show-overflow="true" collapsed fixed> <ui5-tab text="Info" additional-text="3"> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="Attachments" additional-text="24" selected> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="Notes" additional-text="16"> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="People" additional-text="34"> </ui5-tab> </ui5-tabcontainer> TabContainer with tabLayout="Inline" <ui5-tabcontainer tab-layout="Inline" show-overflow="true" collapsed fixed> <ui5-tab text="Monitors" additional-text="(10)"> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="Cameras" additional-text="(2)" selected> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab text="Rooms" additional-text="(16)"> </ui5-tab> </ui5-tabcontainer> <ui5-tabcontainer tab-layout="Inline" show-overflow="true" collapsed fixed> <ui5-tab icon="laptop" ext="Monitors" additional-text="(10)"> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab icon="video" text="Cameras" additional-text="(2)" selected> </ui5-tab> <ui5-tab icon="home" text="Rooms" additional-text="(16)"> </ui5-tab> </ui5-tabcontainer> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-tabcontainer represents a collection of tabs with associated content. Navigation through the tabs changes the content display of the currently active content area. A tab can be labeled with text only, or icons with text. Structure The ui5-tabcontainer can hold two types of entities: <ul> <li>ui5-tab - contains all the information on an item (text and icon)</li> <li>ui5-tab-separator - used to separate tabs with a vertical line</li> </ul> ES6 import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TabContainer"; import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Tab"; (for ui5-tab) import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TabSeparator"; (for ui5-tab-separator) <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> collapsed <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the tab content is collapsed. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> fixed <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the tabs are in a fixed state that is not expandable/collapsible by user interaction. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> showOverflow <br> <code>show-overflow</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the overflow select list is displayed. <br><br> The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed so that it's easier for the user to select a specific tab filter. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> tabLayout <br> <code>tab-layout</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">TabLayout</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;Standard&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the alignment of the <code>main text</code> and the <code>additionalText</code> of a tab. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The <code>main text</code> and the <code>additionalText</code> would be displayed vertically by defualt, but when set to <code>Inline</code>, they would be displayed horizontally. <br><br> Available options are: <ul> <li><code>Standard</code></li> <li><code>Inline</code></li> <ul> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> tabsPlacement <br> <code>tabs-placement</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">TabContainerTabsPlacement</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;Top&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the placement of the tab strip (tab buttons area) relative to the actual tabs' content. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> By default the tab strip is displayed above the tabs' content area and this is the recommended layout for most scenarios. Set to <code>Bottom</code> only when the <code>ui5-tabcontainer</code> is at the bottom of the page and you want the tab strip to act as a menu. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0-rc.7</div> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the tabs. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Use <code>ui5-tab</code> and <code>ui5-tab-separator</code> for the intended design.</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">overflowButton</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the button which will open the overflow menu. If nothing is provided to this slot, the default button will be used.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">tab-select</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when a tab is selected. </div> </div> <tr class="api-table-event-param"> <div class="api-table-content-event-params-wrapper"> <div class="cell api-table-param-name api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">tab</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> HTMLElement <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> The selected <code>tab</code>.</div> </div> </tr> <tr class="api-table-event-param"> <div class="api-table-content-event-params-wrapper"> <div class="cell api-table-param-name api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">tabIndex</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> Number <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> The selected <code>tab</code> index.</div> </div> </tr> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>Tab</h1> <section class="component-description"> The <code>ui5-tab</code> represents a selectable item inside a <code>ui5-tabcontainer</code>. It defines both the item in the tab strip (top part of the <code>ui5-tabcontainer</code>) and the content that is presented to the user once the tab is selected. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> additionalText <br> <code>additional-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Represents the "additionalText" text, which is displayed in the tab filter. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> disabled <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Enabled items can be selected. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> icon <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the icon source URI to be displayed as graphical element within the <code>ui5-tab</code>. The SAP-icons font provides numerous built-in icons. See all the available icons in the <ui5-link target="_blank" href="https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html" class="api-table-content-cell-link">Icon Explorer</ui5-link>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> selected <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Specifies if the <code>ui5-tab</code> is selected. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> semanticColor <br> <code>semantic-color</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">SemanticColor</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;Default&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the <code>ui5-tab</code> semantic color. <br><br> The color is applied to: <ul> <li>the <code>ui5-tab</code> icon</li> <li>the <code>text</code> when <code>ui5-tab</code> overflows</li> <li>the tab selection line</li> </ul> <br><br> Available semantic colors are: <code>"Default"</code>, <code>"Neutral"</code>, <code>"Positive"</code>, <code>"Critical"</code> and <code>"Negative"</code>. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The color value depends on the current theme. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> stableDomRef <br> <code>stable-dom-ref</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">undefined</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the stable selector that you can use via getStableDomRef method. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0-rc.8</div> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> text <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> The text to be displayed for the item. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the tab content.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TabSeparator</h1> <section class="component-description"> The <code>ui5-tab-separator</code> represents a vertical line to separate tabs inside a <code>ui5-tabcontainer</code>. <section class="component-api space-top"> </section> </section> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

class="nt">&lt;ui5-table-column</span> <span class="na">slot=</span><span class="s">"columns"</span> <span class="na">min-width=</span><span class="s">"600"</span> <span class="na">popin-text=</span><span class="s">"Weight"</span> <span class="na">demand-popin</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;span</span> <span class="na">style=</span><span class="s">"line-height: 1.4rem"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>Weight<span class="nt">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;/ui5-table-column&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;ui5-table-column</span> <span class="na">slot=</span><span class="s">"columns"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;span</span> <span class="na">style=</span><span class="s">"line-height: 1.4rem"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>Price<span class="nt">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;/ui5-table-column&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;/ui5-table&gt;</span> </code></pre></figure></pre> </section> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-table component provides a set of sophisticated and convenient functions for responsive table design. It provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data. To render the Table properly, the order of the columns should match with the order of the item cells in the rows. Desktop and tablet devices are supported. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Table.js"; import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TableColumn.js"; (for ui5-table-column) import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TableRow.js"; (for ui5-table-row) import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TableCell.js"; (for ui5-table-cell) <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> noDataText <br> <code>no-data-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the text that will be displayed when there is no data and <code>showNoData</code> is present. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> showNoData <br> <code>show-no-data</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines if the value of <code>noDataText</code> will be diplayed when there is no rows present in the table. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> stickyColumnHeader <br> <code>sticky-column-header</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines whether the column headers remain fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the Web Component is in the viewport. <br><br> <b>Limitations:</b> <ul> <li>Browsers that do not support this feature: <ul> <li>Internet Explorer</li> <li>Microsoft Edge lower than version 41 (EdgeHTML 16)</li> <li>Mozilla Firefox lower than version 59</li> </ul> </li> <li>Scrolling behavior: <ul> <li>If the Web Component is placed in layout containers that have the <code>overflow: hidden</code> or <code>overflow: auto</code> style definition, this can prevent the sticky elements of the Web Component from becoming fixed at the top of the viewport.</li> </ul> </li> </ul> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">columns</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the configuration for the columns of the <code>ui5-table</code>. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Use <code>ui5-table-column</code> for the intended design.</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the <code>ui5-table</code> rows. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Use <code>ui5-table-row</code> for the intended design.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">popin-change</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the <code>ui5-table-column</code> is shown as a pop-in instead of hiding it. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0-rc.6</div> </div> </div> <tr class="api-table-event-param"> <div class="api-table-content-event-params-wrapper"> <div class="cell api-table-param-name api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">poppedColumns</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> Array <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> popped-in columns.</div> </div> </tr> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">row-click</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when a row is clicked. </div> </div> <tr class="api-table-event-param"> <div class="api-table-content-event-params-wrapper"> <div class="cell api-table-param-name api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">row</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> HTMLElement <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> the clicked row.</div> </div> </tr> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TableColumn</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-table-column component allows to define column specific properties that are applied when rendering the ui5-table component. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> demandPopin <br> <code>demand-popin</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> According to your <code>minWidth</code> settings, the <code>ui5-table-column</code> can be hidden in different screen sizes. <br><br> Setting this property to <code>true</code>, shows this column as pop-in instead of hiding it. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> minWidth <br> <code>min-width</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Infinity</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the minimum table width required to display this column. By default it is always displayed. <br><br> The responsive behavior of the <code>ui5-table</code> is determined by this property. As an example, by setting <code>minWidth</code> property to <code>40em</code> shows this column on tablet (and desktop) but hides it on mobile. <br> For further responsive design options, see <code>demandPopin</code> property. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> popinText <br> <code>popin-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> The text for the column when it pops in. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the content of the column header.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TableRow</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-table-row component represents a row in the ui5-table. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the cells of the <code>ui5-table-row</code>. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Use <code>ui5-table-cell</code> for the intended design.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TableCell</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-table-cell component defines the structure of the data in a single ui5-table cell. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Specifies the content of the <code>ui5-table-cell</code>.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

131.title: Text Area
131.content: TextArea @ui5/webcomponents <ui5-textarea> Basic TextArea <ui5-textarea placeholder="Type as much text as you wish"></ui5-textarea> TextArea with Maximum Length <ui5-textarea placeholder="Type some text" maxlength="10" show-exceeded-text></ui5-textarea> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-textarea component provides large spaces for text entries in the form of multiple rows. It has the functionality of the TextField with the additional functionality for multiline texts. When empty, it can hold a placeholder similar to a ui5-input. You can define the rows of the ui5-textarea and also determine specific behavior when handling long texts. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TextArea"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> disabled <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Indicates whether the user can interact with the component or not. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Disabled components cannot be focused and they are out of the tab chain. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> growing <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Enables the <code>ui5-textarea</code> to automatically grow and shrink dynamically with its content. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> If set to <code>true</code>, the CSS <code>height</code> property is ignored. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> growingMaxLines <br> <code>growing-max-lines</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">0</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the maximum number of lines that the Web Component can grow. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> maxlength <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">null</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the maximum number of characters that the <code>value</code> can have. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> name <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines the name with which the <code>ui5-textarea</code> will be submitted in an HTML form. <br><br> <b>Important:</b> For the <code>name</code> property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: <code>import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";</code> <br><br> <b>Note:</b> When set, a native <code>input</code> HTML element will be created inside the <code>ui5-textarea</code> so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> placeholder <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the component has no value. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> readonly <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-textarea</code> is read-only. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> A read-only <code>ui5-textarea</code> is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> required <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-textarea</code> is required. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0-rc.3</div> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> rows <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">0</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the number of visible text lines for the component. <br><br> <b>Notes:</b> <ul> <li>If the <code>growing</code> property is enabled, this property defines the minimum rows to be displayed in the textarea.</li> <li>The CSS <code>height</code> property wins over the <code>rows</code> property, if both are set.</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> showExceededText <br> <code>show-exceeded-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines whether the characters exceeding the maximum allowed character count are visible in the <code>ui5-textarea</code>. <br><br> If set to <code>false</code>, the user is not allowed to enter more characters than what is set in the <code>maxlength</code> property. If set to <code>true</code> the characters exceeding the <code>maxlength</code> value are selected on paste and the counter below the <code>ui5-textarea</code> displays their number. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> value <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the value of the Web Component. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> valueState <br> <code>value-state</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">ValueState</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;None&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the value state of the <code>ui5-textarea</code>. <br><br> Available options are: <ul> <li><code>None</code></li> <li><code>Error</code></li> <li><code>Warning</code></li> <li><code>Success</code></li> <li><code>Information</code></li> </ul> <br><br> <b>Note:</b> If <code>maxlength</code> property is set, the component turns into "Warning" state once the characters exceeds the limit. In this case, only the "Error" state is considered and can be applied. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0-rc.7</div> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">valueStateMessage</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the value state message that will be displayed as pop up under the <code>ui5-textarea</code>. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> If not specified, a default text (in the respective language) will be displayed. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The <code>valueStateMessage</code> would be displayed if the <code>ui5-textarea</code> has <code>valueState</code> of type <code>Information</code>, <code>Warning</code> or <code>Error</code>.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">change</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the text has changed and the focus leaves the <code>ui5-textarea</code>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">input</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the value of the <code>ui5-textarea</code> changes at each keystroke or when something is pasted. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0-rc.5</div> </div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

133.title: Time Picker
133.content: TimePicker v1.0.0-rc.6 @ui5/webcomponents <ui5-time-picker> Basic TimePicker <ui5-time-picker id="timepicker1"></ui5-time-picker> TimePicker in twelve hours format <ui5-time-picker id="timepicker1" format-pattern="hh:mm:ss a"></ui5-time-picker> TimePicker with only minutes and seconds <ui5-time-picker id="timepicker2" format-pattern="mm:ss"></ui5-time-picker> TimePicker with value-state and valueStateMessage Please provide valid value <ui5-time-picker id="timepicker3" format-pattern="mm:ss" value-state="Error"> <div slot="valueStateMessage">Please provide valid value</div> </ui5-time-picker> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The <code>ui5-time-picker</code> component provides an input field with assigned sliders which opens on user action. The <code>ui5-time-picker</code> allows users to select a localized time using touch, mouse, or keyboard input. It consists of two parts: the time input field and the sliders. Usage The user can enter a time by: <ul> <li>Using the sliders that opens in a popup</li> <li>Typing it in directly in the input field</li> </ul> When the user makes an entry and chooses the enter key, the sliders shows the corresponding time. When the user directly triggers the sliders display, the actual time is displayed. For the ui5-time-picker Formatting If a time is entered by typing it into the input field, it must fit to the used time format. Supported format options are pattern-based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. For more information, see UTS #35: Unicode Locale Data Markup Language. For example, if the format-pattern is “HH:mm:ss”, a valid value string is “11:42:35” and the same is displayed in the input. Keyboard handling [F4], [ALT]+[UP], [ALT]+[DOWN] Open/Close picker dialog and move focus to it. When closed: <ul> <li>[PAGEUP] - Increments hours by 1. If 12 am is reached, increment hours to 1 pm and vice versa.</li> <li>[PAGEDOWN] - Decrements the corresponding field by 1. If 1 pm is reached, decrement hours to 12 am and vice versa.</li> <li>[SHIFT]+[PAGEUP] Increments minutes by 1.</li> <li>[SHIFT]+ [PAGEDOWN] Decrements minutes by 1.</li> <li>[SHIFT]+[CTRL]+[PAGEUP] Increments seconds by 1.</li> <li>[SHIFT]+[CTRL]+ [PAGEDOWN] Decrements seconds by 1.</li> </ul> When opened: <ul> <li>[UP] If focus is on one of the selection lists: Select the value which is above the current value. If the first value is selected, select the last value in the list. Exception: AM/ PM List: stay on the first item.</li> <li>[DOWN] If focus is on one of the selection lists: Select the value which is below the current value. If the last value is selected, select the first value in the list. Exception: AM/ PM List: stay on the last item.</li> <li>[LEFT] If focus is on one of the selection lists: Move focus to the selection list which is left of the current selection list. If focus is at the first selection list, move focus to the last selection list.</li> <li>[RIGHT] If focus is on one of the selection lists: Move focus to the selection list which is right of the current selection list. When focus is at the last selection list, move focus to the first selection list.</li> <li>[PAGEUP] If focus is on one of the selection lists: Move focus to the first entry of this list.</li> <li>[PAGEDOWN] If focus is on one of the selection lists: Move focus to the last entry of this list.</li> </ul> ES6 Module Import import @ui5/webcomponents/dist/TimePicker.js"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> dateValue (readonly) <br> <code>date-value</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Date</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Currently selected date represented as JavaScript Date instance </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> disabled <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines whether the <code>ui5-time-picker</code> is displayed as disabled. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> formatPattern <br> <code>format-pattern</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines the format, displayed in the input field. Example: HH:mm:ss -> 11:42:35 hh:mm:ss a -> 2:23:15 PM mm:ss -> 12:04 (only minutes and seconds) </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> placeholder <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">undefined</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines a short hint, intended to aid the user with data entry when the <code>ui5-time-picker</code> has no value. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> When no placeholder is set, the format pattern is displayed as a placeholder. Passing an empty string as the value of this property will make the <code>ui5-time-picker</code> appear empty - without placeholder or format pattern. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> readonly <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines whether the <code>ui5-time-picker</code> is displayed as readonly. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> value <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">undefined</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines a formatted time value. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> valueState <br> <code>value-state</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">ValueState</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;None&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the value state of the <code>ui5-time-picker</code>. <br><br> Available options are: <ul> <li><code>None</code></li> <li><code>Error</code></li> <li><code>Warning</code></li> <li><code>Success</code></li> <li><code>Information</code></li> </ul> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">valueStateMessage</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the value state message that will be displayed as pop up under the <code>ui5-time-picker</code>. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> If not specified, a default text (in the respective language) will be displayed. <br> <b>Note:</b> The <code>valueStateMessage</code> would be displayed, when the <code>ui5-time-picker</code> is in <code>Information</code>, <code>Warning</code> or <code>Error</code> value state.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">change</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the input operation has finished by clicking the "OK" button or when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">input</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the value of the <code>ui5-time-picker</code> is changed at each key stroke. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Methods</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component exposes public methods. You can invoke them directly on the Web Component instance.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">closePicker</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Closes the picker</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">formatValue</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Formats a Java Script date object into a string representing a locale date and time according to the <code>formatPattern</code> property of the TimePicker instance</div> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-param-name">oDate</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> object <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> A Java Script date object to be formatted as string</div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">isOpen</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Checks if a value is valid against the current date format of the TimePicker</div> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-param-name">value</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> string <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> A value to be tested against the current date format</div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">isValid</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Checks if a value is valid against the current format patternt of the TimePicker. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> an empty string is considered as valid value.</div> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-param-name">value</div> <div class="cell api-table-event-param-cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"><strong class="bold" >type:</strong> string <br/> <strong class="api-table-event-description bold">description:</strong> The value to be tested against the current date format</div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">openPicker</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Opens the picker. <code>{ focusInput: true }</code> By default, the focus goes in the picker after opening it. Specify this option to focus the input field.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

135.title: Timeline
135.content: Timeline v0.8.0 @ui5/webcomponents <ui5-timeline> Basic Timeline MR SOF02 2.43 Online meeting <ui5-timeline> <ui5-timeline-item id="test-item" title-text="called" subtitle-text="20.02.2017 11:30" icon="phone" item-name="John Smith" item-name-clickable></ui5-timeline-item> <ui5-timeline-item title-text="Weekly Sync - CP Design" subtitle-text="27.07.2017 (11:00 - 12:30)" icon="calendar"> <div>MR SOF02 2.43</div> </ui5-timeline-item> <ui5-timeline-item title-text="Video Converence Call - UI5" subtitle-text="31.01.2018 (12:00 - 13:00)" icon="calendar"> <div>Online meeting</div> </ui5-timeline-item> </ui5-timeline> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-timeline component shows entries (such as objects, events, or posts) in chronological order. A common use case is to provide information about changes to an object, or events related to an object. These entries can be generated by the system (for example, value XY changed from A to B), or added manually. There are two distinct variants of the timeline: basic and social. The basic timeline is read-only, while the social timeline offers a high level of interaction and collaboration, and is integrated within SAP Jam. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Determines the content of the <code>ui5-timeline</code>.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TimelineItem</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> An entry posted on the timeline. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> icon <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the <code>ui5-timeline-item</code>. SAP-icons font provides numerous options. <br><br> See all the available icons in the <ui5-link target="_blank" href="https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html" class="api-table-content-cell-link">Icon Explorer</ui5-link>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> itemName <br> <code>item-name</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the name of the item. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> itemNameClickable <br> <code>item-name-clickable</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>itemName</code> is clickable. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> subtitleText <br> <code>subtitle-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the subtitle text of the component. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> titleText <br> <code>title-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the title text of the component. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Determines the description of the <code>ui5-timeline-item</code>.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">item-name-click</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the item name is pressed either with a click/tap or by using the Enter or Space key. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The event will not be fired if the <code>item-name-clickable</code> attribute is not set. </div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

It is a simple, large-sized text with explicit header/title semantics. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Title"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> level <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">TitleLevel</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;H2&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the <code>ui5-title</code> level. Available options are: <code>"H6"</code> to <code>"H1"</code>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> wrap <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-title</code> would wrap. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the text of the <code>ui5-title</code>. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

139.title: Toast
139.content: Toast v1.0.0-rc.6 @ui5/webcomponents <ui5-toast> Basic Toast Basic Toast Basic Toast <!--Basic Toast--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastBasic" class="samples-margin">Basic Toast</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastBasic">Basic Toast</ui5-toast> <script> // Attaching click listener to the Button which shows the Basic Toast wcBtnShowToastBasic.addEventListener('click', function () { wcToastBasic.show(); }); </script> Toast Duration Short Toast <ui5-toast id="wcToastShort" duration=1500 placement="BottomStart">Short Toast</ui5-toast> Long Toast <ui5-toast id="wcToastLong" duration=4500 placement="BottomEnd">Long Toast</ui5-toast> <!--Short Toast--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastShort" class="samples-margin">Short Toast</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastShort" duration=1500 placement="BottomStart">Short Toast</ui5-toast> <!--Long Toast--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastLong" class="samples-margin">Long Toast</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastLong" duration=4500 placement="BottomEnd">Long Toast</ui5-toast> <script> // Attaching click listener to the Button which shows the Short Toast wcBtnShowToastShort.addEventListener('click', function () { wcToastShort.show(); }); // Attaching click listener to the Button which shows the Long Toast wcBtnShowToastLong.addEventListener('click', function () { wcToastLong.show(); }); </script> Toast Placements TopStart TopStart TopCenter TopCenter TopEnd TopEnd MiddleStart MiddleStart MiddleCenter MiddleCenter MiddleEnd MiddleEnd BottomStart BottomStart BottomCenter BottomCenter BottomEnd BottomEnd <!--TopStart--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastTS">TopStart</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastTS" placement="TopStart">TopStart</ui5-toast> <!--TopCenter--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastTC">TopCenter</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastTC" placement="TopCenter">TopCenter</ui5-toast> <!--TopEnd--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastTE">TopEnd</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastTE" placement="TopEnd">TopEnd</ui5-toast> <!--MiddleStart--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastMS">MiddleStart</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastMS" placement="MiddleStart">MiddleStart</ui5-toast> <!--MiddleCenter--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastMC">MiddleCenter</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastMC" placement="MiddleCenter">MiddleCenter</ui5-toast> <!--MiddleEnd--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastME">MiddleEnd</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastME" placement="MiddleEnd">MiddleEnd</ui5-toast> <!--BottomStart--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastBS">BottomStart</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastBS" placement="BottomStart">BottomStart</ui5-toast> <!--BottomCenter--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastBC">BottomCenter</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastBC">BottomCenter</ui5-toast> <!--BottomEnd--> <ui5-button id="wcBtnShowToastBE">BottomEnd</ui5-button> <ui5-toast id="wcToastBE" placement="BottomEnd">BottomEnd</ui5-toast> <script> // Attaching click listeners to the buttons which show the toasts Array.from(document.querySelectorAll("ui5-button")).forEach(button => { button.addEventListener('click', function () { document.querySelector("#" + button.id.replace("BtnShow", "")).show(); }); }); </script> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-toast is a small, non-disruptive popup for success or information messages that disappears automatically after a few seconds. Usage When to use: You want to display a short success or information message. You do not want to interrupt users while they are performing an action. You want to confirm a successful action. When not to use: You want to display error or warning message. You want to interrupt users while they are performing an action. You want to make sure that users read the message before they leave the page. You want users to be able to copy some part of the message text. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Toast"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> duration <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Integer</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">3000</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the duration in milliseconds for which <code>ui5-toast</code> remains on the screen before it's automatically closed. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The minimum supported value is <code>500</code> ms and even if a lower value is set, the duration would remain <code>500</code> ms. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> placement <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">ToastPlacement</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;BottomCenter&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the placement of the <code>ui5-toast</code> web component. <br><br> Available options are: <ul> <li><code>TopStart</code></li> <li><code>TopCenter</code></li> <li><code>TopEnd</code></li> <li><code>MiddleStart</code></li> <li><code>MiddleCenter</code></li> <li><code>MiddleEnd</code></li> <li><code>BottomStart</code></li> <li><code>BottomCenter</code></li> <li><code>BottomEnd</code></li> </ul> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the text of the <code>ui5-toast</code> web component. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Methods</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component exposes public methods. You can invoke them directly on the Web Component instance.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">show</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Shows the <code>ui5-toast</code>.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>
